intro: Archibaccharis aequivenia, commonly known as the coastal hibiscus, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southeastern Brazil. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. It is often found in dune ecosystems and is adapted to salt spray and coastal winds. Archibaccharis aequivenia plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for local wildlife.
